result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Spencer Strong

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Kevin Spencer Strong.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial Conference.  Judge was on defendant's CHIPS case and offered to recuse herself from the case.  Defendant declines and wishes to proceed.  Defense counsel motion to withdraw heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court removes defense counsel and vacates jury trial dates.  Defendant to be produced for next hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong not in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Kevin Spencer Strong.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial Conference.  Due to the lateness of the hour and issues of defendant being produced by zoom, Court will adjourn case.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Motion to Withdraw as Counsel and to Allow Mr. Strong to Proceed Pro Se
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Motion to Admit Videotaped Statement in the Interest of Justice Under 908.08
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Kevin Spencer Strong.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defense counsel requests case be scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Travis Schwantes in court, defendant Kevin Spencer Strong not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a Zoom plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court authorizes contact with the child in therapuetic settings ONLY if authorized by DMCPS or CHIPS.

Attorney Travis Schwantes in court, defendant Kevin Spencer Strong not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court authorizes contact with the child in therapuetic settings ONLY if authorized by DMCPS or CHIPS. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify No Contact Order, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Cudahy Officer A. Frick.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Travis Schwantes in court, defendant Kevin Spencer Strong not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Defense counsel has been appointed. Court schedules case for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  lifting NO CONTACT order on this case.  (Kevin S. Strong - #566590, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee Hearing in Branch 35.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  lifting NO CONTACT order.  (Kevin Strong - #566590, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KCW
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Kevin Spencer Strong in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Spencer Strong appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defense motions to strike "habitual criminality repeater" enhancer.  State moves to orally amend.  Defense's motion GRANTED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for branch 35.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Court STRIKES enhancer.
